Reason: The configuration option 'range_request_timeout_in_ms' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact the system's performance. A lower timeout value may lead to faster response times but could also increase the likelihood of timeouts and retries, affecting overall system throughput. On the other hand, a higher timeout value may reduce the chances of timeouts but could result in increased latency and resource consumption. Therefore, any change in the 'range_request_timeout_in_ms' configuration can have notable variations in execution time and system performance.
